definition: to take the bait
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
to hook/to sew/to crochet/hook/check mark or tick/window catch
erhua variant of 上鉤|上钩[shang4 gou1]
Jiang Ziya is fishing, if you want take the hook (idiom, refers to early sage 姜子牙 fishing with no bait and the hook above the water); to put one's head in the noose
pinyin: tai4 gong1 diao4 yu2 , yuan4 zhe3 shang4 gou1

definition: Jiang Ziya is fishing, if you want it, take the hook (idiom, refers to early sage 姜子牙 fishing with no bait and the hook above the water); to put one's head in the noose
pinyin: Jiang1 tai4 gong1 diao4 yu2 , yuan4 zhe3 shang4 gou1

sentences.english: I've been sitting here for hours but the fish aren't biting.
sentences.chinese: 釣魚人等了好久，可是沒有魚上鉤。

sentences.english: "Better than you know, " said Tyrion, refusing to rise to the bait.
sentences.chinese: “比你所知的好得多呢，”提利昂說，拒絕上鉤。

sentences.english: Tell him that there will be lots of food and he will rise to the bait .
sentences.chinese: 你告訴他到時候會有很多喫的，他會上鉤的。

sentences.english: The fish will soon be caught that nibbles at every bait.
sentences.chinese: 見餌就咬的魚，很快就會上鉤。

sentences.english: In France, people call the April Fools “April Fish”.
sentences.chinese: 在法國，被愚弄的人成爲“上鉤的魚”。

sentences.english: Bassy smiled proudly and said, "Did you guys see that?Eat the meat, not the hook."
sentences.chinese: 巴思洋洋得意地說，“看見了吧，喫肉，但是不上鉤。

sentences.english: "The Hobbit" first hooked her when she was around 10.
sentences.chinese: “哈比人”上鉤她，當她第一次約10個。

sentences.english: For the first time, sales teams were paid according to their contributions to gross profit.
sentences.chinese: 銷售團隊的薪酬第一次跟其對毛利潤的貢獻掛上鉤。

sentences.english: A fisherman waits for a bite after casting into the lurid green surface of Xingyun Lake in Yunnan.
sentences.chinese: 圖中爲雲南星雲湖，一位垂釣者正等着魚兒上鉤。

sentences.english: It says that ‘More traps will lure you away.
sentences.chinese: 別忘了那句話‘陷阱誘你上鉤’。

sentences.english: Then he began to pity the great fish that he had hooked.
sentences.chinese: 然後，他開始可憐那條已經上鉤的大魚。

sentences.english: Believing unyieldingly a fish will come to the hook.
Nervousness or exuberant outbursts of emotion are not usually associated with Virgos.
sentences.chinese: 神經質或者是激情澎湃很難與處女座掛上鉤。

sentences.english: Now it was the turn of the "education survey specialist" to rise to the bait.
sentences.chinese: 現在也該是“教育調研員”上鉤的時候了。

sentences.english: The more often a fish is nearly caught, the more difficult it will be to interest it next time.
sentences.chinese: 一條魚逃脫的次數越多，下一次就越難引得它上鉤。

sentences.english: Stainless steel fishhooks of superB quality easily catch fish.
sentences.chinese: 不鏽鋼魚鉤，超高品質，引魚上鉤。

definition: to throw a net
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
brazen
better to have nothing (than substandard choice) (idiom); would prefer to go without than accept shoddy option
to digress/to stray from the subject
to penetrate/to see through
to both be willing/mutual consent
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
prolonged war/war of attrition
not essential/dispensable
In order to capture, one must let loose./to loosen the reins only to grasp them better
indecisive/wavering
to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
to fail to grasp the main points
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
